      • getFormat

        public MessageFormat getFormat(String key)
        Look up the specified key in the receiver's resource bundle. Create and return a new MessageFormat with the returned value. No exceptions are thrown in this method, since the getString() method always returns a non-null string.
        Parameters:
        key - parameter
        Returns:
        MessageFormat
        See Also:
        MessageFormat

      • getFormattedMessage

        public String getFormattedMessage(String key,
                         Object[] args)
        Look up a key and use a MessageFormat to format it, plugging in arguments.
        Parameters:
        key - Key to look up in resource bundle
        args - Array of arguments
        Returns:
        Formatted message

      • getStringSafely

        public String getStringSafely(String key)
        Look up the specified key in the receiver's resource bundle. Cast the value to a String and return it. If the key does not exist return a default key
        Parameters:
        key - parameter
        Returns:
        String

      • getStringSafely

        public String getStringSafely(String key,
                     boolean trimPackageName)
        Look up the specified key in the receiver's resource bundle. Cast the value to a String and return it. If the key does not exist return either the key, or the key stripped of its package name ie.
        Parameters:
        key - the lookup key
        trimPackageName - decide if we trim the package name if the key does not exist true will trim it, false won't
        Returns:
        String the String value associated to this key.

      • getURL

        public URL getURL(String key)
           throws ChainedException
        Look up the specified key in the receiver's resource bundle. Assume that the found value is the name of a file which may be found on the classpath, or in a .jar file on the classpath. Use the java.lang.Class method to locate a file anywhere in these locations and return an URL for that file. Return the URL. WARNING: throws an exception if the file cannot be located
        Parameters:
        key - parameter
        Returns:
        URL
        Throws:
        ChainedException - on error
        See Also:
        Class.getResource(java.lang.String)

      • getURLByValue

        public URL getURLByValue(String value)
                  throws ChainedException
        Look up the specified file as passed-in return an URL for that file. Return the URL. WARNING: returns null if the desired file could not be found.
        Parameters:
        value - parameter
        Returns:
        URL
        Throws:
        ChainedException - on error
        See Also:
        Class.getResource(java.lang.String)
